March 5, 1951
Mrs* Gertrude Broderick
Radio Education Specialist
Office of Education
Federal Security Agency
Washington 25, D* C*
Bear Mrs* Broderick:
We have finally received definite word on the Atomic Energy
Series done by WLS, Chicago. We also received from Mr. Heslep
a copy of the letter which he wrote to you. This is an attempt
to let you know what we are doing about the series.
I have contacted WLS asking them to send copies of the
programs to us for duplication. Meanwhile, I will make a list
of all the stations interested in carrying the series which I
will forward to AFRA headquarters hoping that they will then
give us appropriate clearances. Once all of this has been done
as nearly as I can tell, we will be clear to send the programs ,
out on the network.
It if is agreeable with you, I should like to make a
proposal concerning the stations wfjto would be interested in
dubbing copies of the program for use beyond a single broadcast
of a series. I will mention in my letter to AFRA that some of
the stations probably would be interested in doing this. ParticuÂ¬
larly the school stations would be interested. Vie do not yet
have any kind of facilities for operating a library service. We
hope to have some day. If such use is agreeable to AFRA, there
apparently will be no problem involved. If they are hesitant to
grant such a clearance, additional action would seem to be
indicated. I thought maybe you would have some ideas on this
phase of the problem.
Hoping that this makes some sense and looking forward
to continued cooperation with your office, I am,
Cordially yours,
Richard L. Rider
Manager
NAEB TAPE NETWORK
